result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M Byrd

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:55 AM Defendant James M Byrd in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for James M Byrd.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State has complied with victim's rights. 
Cases called for Jury Status in 21CM1779 and 22CF154. A third case was recently filed. 
Parties have reached a global resolution.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date with enough time to allow Defendant to complete prerequisites to accept global offer. 
The jury trial is removed from the calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James M Byrd in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for James M Byrd.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/NaturalLawn of America listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:41 AM Defendant James M Byrd in court with attorney Angela Wang.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 06/24/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
